clinical_study.brief_title: Short- and Long-Term Renal Outcomes Following Lung Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Short- and Long-Term Renal Outcomes Following Lung Transplantation- A Single-Centre Experience

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of acute kidney injury, renal recovery and development of chronic kidney disease in patients undergoing lung transplantation

detailed_description.textblock: It is well described that acute kidney injury and development of chronic kidney disease significantly impact short- and long-term survival after lung transplantation. However, there is limited data about prevalence of kidney disease according to current KDIGO consensus guidelines. It is the aim of this study to describe short- and long-Term Renal Outcomes following Lung Transplantation.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of chronic kidney disease (CKD) prior lung transplantation
Prevalence and severity of acute kidney injury (AKI) according to KDIGO Clinical Practise Guidelines.
Prevalence of sustained reversal after AKI and clinically manifest CKD after AKI (non-recovery) at three-month follow-up.
Whether development of CKD is an independent risk factor for death after lung transplantation.
Evaluation and identification of possible causes for CKD development during median follow-up period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk factors associated with development of AKI and CKD.

study_pop.textblock: All patients undergoing lung transplantation at University Clinic Giessen and Marburg between 2003 and 2016

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Older than 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with eGFR < 15ml/min or with chronic dialysis treatment prior LTx
- Patients undergoing retransplantation, combined heart- lung transplants, multiorgan transplants, and patients missing preoperative creatinine
